ygData.subject: Re: The houseplant and the goons
ygData.msgSnippet: Look, pal, do you want to go home in one piece or a thousand? Fury threatens.  Gatara plants her hand on his shoulder to stop him from doing anything

"Look, pal, do you want to go home in one piece or a thousand?" Fury 
threatens.  Gatara plants her hand on his shoulder to stop him from 
doing anything foolish.

"The Maximal has a point, Devilcat - we won't be well-received," she 
says.

"Have any of you ever known a Maximal leader to turn down a truce?" 
Devilcat points out.

"He's right," Riekan puts in, "and having seen us in battle, they 
can't deny we'd be better to have as an ally than an enemy."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
<wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Yggdrasil took his chin in his hand.
> 
> Yggdrasil: That could be an idea... (he took on a mocking tone) but
> weren't you the ones to attack the Maximals?
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > "Definitely a Tripredacus ship," Gatara states.
> > 
> > "Indeed," Devilcat agrees, "which is why I propose we ally 
ourselves 
> > with the Maximals."  The other Rogues look blankly at 
him.  "They're 
> > the only faction on this planet we know won't double-cross us.  
And 
> > they're far more open-minded to boot.  Not to mention our guest 
here 
> > is a Maximal himself."  He leaves unsaid the fact that he 
considers 
> > Yggdrasil as little more than a bargaining chip at the moment.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Yggdrasil didn't like democracies, especially in combat units. 
It 
> > just
> > > twisted everything up. But, they weren't his troops and he had 
no
> > > standing.
> > > 
> > > Yggdrasil: THAT is definitely no rookie work. The way they land,
> > > they're experienced. It does remind me of Pred style, but it's
> > > different too. I just can't put my finger on it.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > "After a fashion, yes." The trio reaches the control room of 
the 
> > > > Rogue Star.  Unlike much of the ship, it looks entirely 
> > Cybertronian.
> > > > 
> > > > Noir is already there.  Gatara, Fury, and Riekan arrive one 
at a 
> > time 
> > > > afterward.
> > > > 
> > > > Devilcat smiles.  "Good, we're all here.  Computer, replay 
visual 
> > > > from the arrival of the newest ship."  A holo-field pops up, 
> > > > displaying the Tripredacus cruiser as it came in for a 
landing 
> > some 
> > > > time ago.  The image is a bit fuzzy, but it's obvious the 
ship is 
> > > > state-of-the-art.
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Yggdrasil: I see. Your group is a democracy right?
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > > > "That's what we're going to discuss," Devilcat 
explains.  "I 
> > > > might be 
> > > > > > in charge, but some decisions can't be made by only one 
> > person."
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > Yggdrasil walks just besides Devilcat.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Yggdrasil: What are your intentions now?
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> 
wrote:
> > > > > > > > "I doubt they've had much time to gather data on us 
> > directly, 
> > > > but 
> > > > > > our 
> > > > > > > > reputation precedes us.  Our ship is a distinctive 
one 
> > and 
> > > > has 
> > > > > > been 
> > > > > > > > connected officially with dozens of terrorist acts, 
> > including 
> > > > the 
> > > > > > > > destruction of some important Tripredacus outposts."
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > Devilcat considers for a moment.  Activating his 
comlink, 
> > he 
> > > > > > issues a 
> > > > > > > > command to the Rogues: "Everyone meet me in the 
command 
> > > > center - 
> > > > > > > > stat!  We've got business to discuss."  He heads out 
of 
> > the 
> > > > room, 
> > > > > > > > beckoning Yggdrasil and Jayde to follow him.
> > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> 
wrote:
> > > > > > > > > Yggdrasil came up near Devilcat and looked at the 
data 
> > > > > > displayed.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > Yggdrasil: That is a new ship design. Seems like a 
> > warship 
> > > > to 
> > > > > > me, 
> > > > > > > > and
> > > > > > > > > since it's new, they might well have lots more 
where 
> > they 
> > > > come 
> > > > > > from.
> > > > > > > > > That means they're not alone. As for personel, I 
can't 
> > say 
> > > > > > much. 
> > > > > > > > Never
> > > > > > > > > fought Tripreds. But they might be elite, or they 
might 
> > be 
> > > > green
> > > > > > > > > rookies that have been placed there to man the 
ship. 
> > > > However, 
> > > > > > > > rookies
> > > > > > > > > could not have landed the ship as successfully as 
they 
> > just 
> > > > > > did. 
> > > > > > > > There
> > > > > > > > > is something else. The survivors of the first group 
> > > > probably 
> > > > > > had 
> > > > > > > > time
> > > > > > > > > to observe things here and I am convinced that they 
> > have 
> > > > > > gathered 
> > > > > > > > some
> > > > > > > > > intelligence on most people here. The newcomers now 
> > have 
> > > > that 
> > > > > > edge. 
> > > > > > > > A
> > > > > > > > > frontal assault is totally out of question.
